column4: i am trying to install packages for ubuntu apache2 for a long time now but i get this error: http://bin.cakephp.org/view/500305249 it is very frstrating...what am I missing?
apt-get update was to make sure your cache was up to date
but if there is some problem will -f (force) it not potentially make it much worse?
apt-get --help shows all the possible flags
did you add any other sources ?
yeah but for other things...long time ago
it removes anything related to apache2(specifically whatever you've installed thats been tagged as apache2)
but wont ii be needing that?
what about all my config files then and all that
back them up to another directory
